FuncDef:
The raps-mel command sets the value of the maintenance entity group level (MEL) field in R-APS PDUs.
The undo raps-mel command restores the default value of the MEL field.
By default, the value of the MEL field in R-APS PDUs is 7.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the value of the MEL field in R-APS PDUs.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 7. The default is 7.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
On a Layer 2 network where ERPS is running, if the connectivity fault management (CFM) protocol is enabled, the MEL field in R-APS PDUs determines whether these ERPS protocols have a higher priority and can be forwarded. If the MEL value of the ERPS ring is smaller than the MEL value of the CFM protocol, the packets have a lower priority and are discarded. You can run the raps-mel command to set the value of the MEL field in R-APS PDUs.
In addition to determining whether packets can be forwarded, the MEL value can also be used to facilitate the communications with other vendors' devices in the ERPS ring. The same MEL value ensures smooth communications between devices.
